Text:
Feeling an abrupt buildup of magic, Alexia and
Natsume run toward its source.
What was that surge of magic just now?
Rose...!
Alexia...
Rose stands before them.
You look... What exactly happened?
Rose?!
I gained power...and I will follow my convictions.
Wait? What are you talking about?!
Why did you stab your fiance?!
Forgive me...
I don't want to get you involved.

But that doesn't explain anything! At least tell us
why.
Rose glances back at Alexia's shout.
If I do, there will be no turning back for you.

She looks at Alexia as if seeing something that
is somehow too bright.
Alexia glares back angrily.
We swore back then, did we not?

If we remain spectators, we're going to eventually
lose everything we hold dear.

That's why we agreed we'd protect that stuff
together.
So how can you say all this?
Do you think I'm just a spectator too?!
Forgive me...

Rose seems to gaze somewhere far away as she takes
in Alexia's words.
Answer me!!!
I cannot go back now...so I'm jealous of you.
For what?

I've already lost so much, and I'm sure I'll lose
even more.
Others will likely denounce me and defame me as evil.
So...that's it?
I am sorry...but I must go.
Enough!
Alexia throws aside the lantern and grips her sword.
If that's how you're gonna beâ€”
then I'll force an answer out of you!!!
Both of them spring into action at once.

Their reactions are simultaneous, the speed of their
sword strokes equal.
And their skill levels are perfectly matched.
Rose is the best dark knight at the academy.

One would think she would be on a different level
than Alexia.

Compared to when she first enrolled, at the very
least.

But, in an exceptionally short time, Alexia's
swordplay has improved to the point that it is
almost unrecognizable.
I'm through being a bystander!
Her swordplay resembles his.
Yes, her swordplay...
is that of Shadow's.
Haaaaaah!!!
Steel clashes together.
A burst of magic lights the area.

Though the two are almost evenly matched,
the outcome is obvious.
The deciding factor is a sheer difference in magic.
If Alexia had possessed the same magical ability...
the outcome would not be so clear.
Alexia... You've grown so strong...
Natsume... I am truly sorry.
I must go now.
I won't stop you. I don't have the right to.
Her expression is unreadable as she speaks.

The Natsume that Rose knows always has a gentle
look upon her face.
Natsume...?
Natsume casts a glance at Alexia.

However, that was slightly unexpected. Even fools
have their own concerns, it would seem.

We do not share the same homelands, allegiances,
or even beliefs.

And yet, I think perhaps we are all aiming for the
same thing.

If things were different...we may have made for a
fairly decent team.

I'm certain our paths will cross again before long,
but in the meantime, I wish you luck in the battles
ahead...
Rose has many questions she wants to ask.

However, she knows that neither of them feel like
speaking any longer.
Once she is gone, Natsume lets out a sigh.
Was this your choice...
Master Shadow...?

The piano that had been located on the first-floor
cafe has gone missing.
Yes. The next thing I knew, it was gone.
And in broad daylight. It's so strange...
(The melody echoing in the darkness...)
(The words of the shadowbroker, spun like verse...)
(Yep, I'd say I pulled that off nicely.)
(Pianos really do make the best set pieces.)

(Next time I'll have to get my own instead of
borrowing... Oh.)
Uh...
...Hehe.
